page.title: 09Bird Reserve, Lound (part l)
page.content: Wetlands Waterfowl Park was opened in l982 after 2 years of work on disused gravel pits. The environment was ideal for a bird sanctuary because on the 32 acre site, l8 acres were water and the rest covered by willows, hawthorn, silver birch and oak saplings. An information centre which includes a shop and tea room is sited next to the car park with a view over the West Lake. There are walks round both the West and East lakes with opportunities to view the birds at close quarters in hides. Each hide contains different information on birds, water birds and waders, fungi, wild flowers and butterflies. Mr. Martin Price, the Warden, looks after the Park on his own with volunteer labour. He has introduced 7O different species to the birds already (continued on Page lO)
